info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 11 at 8:57PM CDT until June 12 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT FOR MARION AND NORTHERN LAMAR COUNTIES... At 857 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Tremont to near New Salem to near Amory, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Haleyville, Sulligent, Guin, Hackleburg, Detroit, Beaverton, Weston, Brinn, Crews, Bear Creek, Twin, Henson Springs, Rankin Fite Airport, Upper Bear Creek Reservoir, Pine Springs, Marion County Public Lake, Piney Grove, Tessner and Shottsville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
